description: Grants the user the ability to create, control, and transform into fire. The user becomes a Fire Human. Previously eaten by Portgas D. Ace, the fruit has reincarnated after his death and is now the prize of the Corrida Colosseum tournament.

users.circumstances: Portgas D. Ace ate the fruit in his youth and used it until his death at Marineford

description: Allows the user to turn any part of their body into a spring, making them a Spring Human. The user can compress and release springs for powerful attacks.

users.circumstances: Bellamy ate the fruit at some point before his first appearance

abilityReveals.description: Bellamy transforms his arm into a spring, compressing it and releasing it suddenly in a powerful long-distance punch. Similar to Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Pistol but using spring mechanics.
abilityReveals.firstUseContext: Used against multiple opponents in the Block B battle to quickly eliminate them.

strengths.strength: Enhanced mobility and unpredictable attack angles
strengths.description: The spring properties allow for rapid movement and attacks from unexpected directions.

description: Allows the user to create invisible barriers by crossing their fingers, making them a Barrier Human. The barriers are nearly indestructible and can be used for both offense and defense. Previously eaten by Kurozumi Semimaru, it was later eaten by Bartolomeo after reincarnation.

users.circumstances: Bartolomeo has the Bari Bari no Mi powers, though they are not demonstrated in this episode
